thread.section_title: Best Mutual Funds and ETFs | Reuters.com
thread.title: Credit Suisse exposure to volatility notes hedged

author: Reuters Editorial
title: Credit Suisse exposure to volatility notes hedged
text:
February 6, 2018 / 9:58 AM / in 6 minutes Credit Suisse exposure to volatility notes hedged Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
ZURICH, Feb 6 (Reuters) - Credit Suisse reiterated on Tuesday that it faced no material impact from a sharp drop overnight in the VelocityShares Daily Inverse VIX Short-Term ETN product, in which it has a 32 percent stake. 
“The XIV ETN activity is reflective of today’s market volatility. There is no material impact to Credit Suisse,” a spokesman said. The bank’s exposure was fully hedged. 
Monday’s stock market rout left two of the most popular exchange-traded products (ETPs), which investors use to benefit from calm rather than volatile conditions, facing potential liquidation, market participants said. Reporting by Michael Shields; editing by Jason Neely
